newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian rupee ends down as RBI buys dollars.
newsitem.headline: Indian rupee ends down as RBI buys dollars.

text.p: The Indian rupee weakened against the U.S. currency on Reserve Bank of India (RBI) dollar purchases, dealers said. The rupee ended Tuesday at 35.73/74 per dollar, down from the day's opening 35.70/73, they said.
"There was good supply of dollars in the market today," a dealer said. "But demand was limited and the rupee would have appreciated against the dollar if not for the RBI purchases."
The RBI purchased dollars in the spot market from 35.72 rupees up to 35.7350, dealers said. It also purchase end-August dollars for 35.74 rupees, they said.
The premia on forward dollars moved up on paying pressure, dealers said. "There was some paying pressure on account of month-end rollover of swaps by some banks," a dealer at a foreign bank said.
The premia for six-month dollars ended Tuesday at 11.06 percent, annualised, against Monday's close of 10.81 percent, dealers said.
